dialogues.text: You know me.

scenes.actionPreview: (MARCH 1, 1815) 203 Napoleon and his troops arrived from Elba. We are on the beach that extends between Cannes and Antibes. The INCONSTANT is anchored 100 yards off shore and boats are bringing Napoleon and his men ashore... Leathery FISHERMEN watch him arrive. It’s all very awkward and ungraceful..

FIRE!!!!!

Yes...Emperor.....yes.....

Vive L’Empereur!

scenes.actionPreview: 214 1815) TITLE: (MORE) 93. The mist rises off a great expanse, with three small FARMHOUSES arranged around a gentle hillock. The DUKE OF WELLINGTON walks that hill with his officers. We PUSH PAST him, to reveal a line of British REDCOATS digging trenches along the ridge.

scenes.heading: INT. NAPOLEON'S TENT -- DAY
scenes.actionPreview: 215 Napoleon sits on a copper field toilet, his pants around his ankles. He is doubled over and in great pain. He rises, pulls up his pants, and glances in the toilet. Inside is a half-pint of blood. A hemorrhage.

dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Your Majesty....
Good afternoon......

scenes.actionPreview: 235 Napoleon sits on the grass, sheltering in a grouping of young, thin trees. He is slightly bleeding. His horse mills around him, untethered. PRE-LAP SOUND OF CRISP CLACK OF SHOES ON WOOD FLOOR.....

scenes.heading: INT. ENGLISH SHIP BELLEROPHON, OFF ROCHEFORT - DAY

dialogues.text: Would you like a glass of water?
The hospitality and forgiveness of the British people is what I admire in the face of the European hostility. I imagine I will love the Cotswolds, soft rolling hills and gentle light......
It is by only a narrow margin of opinion that you have been spared the fate of being shot. CU. NAPOLEON this is not the news he was expecting and it’s difficult for Lord Keith to deliver....
Politically, it is impossible for the English government to keep you in England.
Exile will be contained to the island of St. Helena.
St. Helena.
St. Helena is 1000 miles away from the Mainland of Africa. Your correspondences will be read.
Who would suppose that all this would be decided so quickly?

scenes.actionPreview: 236 Napoleon is kept in the belly of this British Warship. He is fraternizing with his captors, eating a full English Breakfast. They are enamored by him, fully engaged....there’s a pause and they stand to attention as DUKE OF WELLINGTON arrives to speak with Napoleon: DIALOGUE TO BE ADDED FOR NAPOL

scenes.heading: EXT. SOUTH ATLANTIC OCEAN - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: 237 Napoleon seeing his final home from a distance. It’s a volcanic rock of an island.

scenes.heading: EXT. ST. HELENA - OLIVE ORCHARD - DAY

dialogues.text: What is the capital of France?
Paris.
Of Russia?
Petersburg. And Moscow before.
Who burnt it?
I don’t know, sir. 103.
It was I who burnt it.
I believe, sir, the Russians burnt it to get rid of the French.

scenes.actionPreview: 238 Daily life is pleasant but dull. There are a few families on the island. Napoleon is warmer, more reflective. He befriends a few of the family’s YOUNG GIRLS. He sits around, joking with them: 104. He laughs and laughs and corrects her.....

scenes.heading: INT. ST HELENA HOME - BEDROOM

dialogues.text: I have beaten the enemy.

scenes.actionPreview: 239 NAPOLEON laying in bed, looking at a picture across the room of Josephine. I am tired to death. I send you a thousand kisses. I am in bed, hopefully I will dream of you. 104.
